programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: Xploration: Animal Science
programme.desc: In this episode we meet human's closest relatives - primates. See what makes a chimpanzee one of the most intelligent primates. Find out why the spider monkey is such an amazing climber and feel the power of the howler monkey's howl.

programme.title: Xploration: Animal Science
programme.desc: In this episode we'll find out how sharks use electro-sensors to detect their prey. Also, discover the skunk's stinky defense mechanism. And domestic versus wild - see how the striped zebra matches up against its cousin the horse.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau looks at new ways of cultivating fresh, nutritious food. He visits a farm in Los Angeles where they grow food on a parking lot, just to show that fresh food can be grown in an urban environment. We also look into what distinguishes fruits from vegetables. The results can be surprising. And then we look at the amount of food that is wasted world wide.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: This week we see how science helps us prepare for natural disasters. Philippe heads to the University of Miami to see their incredible SUSTAIN lab that can simulate a category 5 hurricane. Then it's off to the mountains of Alberta to learn about avalanche safety. From there's we head to South Carolina to follow researchers that study floods.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra heads to Evanston, IL to visit with Northwestern's Izzy Scane. Izzy has been a dominant force for the Wildcats since she first arrived on campus. With a National title, the Tewaaraton Award winner, and record shattering season – she has cemented herself as an all-time great. We also went to Charlottesville, VA to dissect the elite game of Connor Shellenberger: a hometown hero, and arguably the best player in history for the University of Virginia.

programme.title: Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show
programme.desc: Welcome to Episode 32 of the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show presented by Duke Cannon! We are ON SITE at Subaru Park in Philly to recap the PLL semis. We got a surprise appearance from Outlaws attackmen Brennan O'Neill. The boys recap the semis and look ahead to September 14th's dream matchup between the Outlaws and the Atlas.

programme.title: Pregame Plates presented by Whirlpool
programme.desc: Jerry Ragonese, a 13-year pro lacrosse vet turned elite chef is taking his talents, and his long-time friends, into the kitchen. Cooking up epic dishes while uncovering the stories behind the meals that made the lacrosse stars of today.

programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra heads to Evanston, IL to visit with Northwestern's Izzy Scane. Izzy has been a dominant force for the Wildcats since she first arrived on campus. With a National title, the Tewaaraton Award winner, and record shattering season – she has cemented herself as an all-time great. We also went to Charlottesville, VA to dissect the elite game of Connor Shellenberger: a hometown hero, and arguably the best player in history for the University of Virginia.

When Sam learns that she was taken captive by an Indian named Salvaje ten years ago, he attempts to escort Sarah and her half-Native American son to his home in New Mexico. However, it soon becomes clear that Salvaje is hot on their trail.

programme.title: Stagecoach
programme.desc: A motley crew of travelers are forced to band together while making a treacherous crossing through American Indian territory in a rickety stagecoach. Along the way, a drunken doctor (Bing Crosby) finds a moment of redemption, a pregnant captain's wife (Stefanie Powers) discovers the kindness of strangers, a pompous banker (Bob Cummings) gets his comeuppance and a sweet woman with a bad reputation (Ann-Margret) finds love with the Ringo Kid (Alex Cord), a duty-bound cowboy set on revenge.

programme.title: Sergeant Rutledge
programme.desc: At a U.S. Army fort in the Arizona Territory in 1881, an officer is murdered and his beautiful young daughter is beaten, raped and strangled. Army lawyer Tom Cantrell (Jeffrey Hunter) defends the accused, African-American sergeant Braxton Rutledge (Woody Strode), a soldier who had once been under his command. Under questioning by Cantrell and the prosecutor (Carleton Young), multiple witnesses piece together the truth of what happened at the fort that day.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show

programme.title: The Texan

programme.title: Ambush

Prospector Ward Kinsman (Robert Taylor) is enlisted to find the girl because he knows the area well. Though Ward is initially skeptical of the dangerous task, he changes his tune when he finds out that the captive's gorgeous sister, Ann (Arlene Dahl), will be coming along. Unfortunately, their mission and potential romance is soon interrupted by an Apache attack.

programme.title: The Hangman
programme.desc: Townsfolk and a sheriff (Fess Parker) protect a wanted man from a deputy marshal (Robert Taylor) who tracks him down.

programme.title: Cattle King
programme.desc: Cattle rancher Sam Brassfield (Robert Taylor) engages in a war of wills with power-hungry Clay Mathews (Robert Middleton), whose allies include the brother of Brassfield's betrothed. In trying to muscle out the competition, Mathews frames Brassfield for damage to another rancher's property, nearly getting both men killed. But instead they join forces and enlist the help of President Chester A. Arthur (Larry Gates), leading to a shift in power and tension that can be settled only with bullets.

programme.title: The Law and Jake Wade
programme.desc: Bandits Clint Hollister (Richard Widmark) and Jake Wade (Robert Taylor) botch a robbery that ends with Clint imprisoned. Despairing, Jake leaves the loot in an abandoned village and quits crime for good. Now working for the law, Jake helps free his old cohort from jail. Clint doesn't want the treasure to go to waste, however, so he forces Jake and his girlfriend, Peggy (Patricia Owens), to lead him to the stash. But to unearth the money, they'll have to get past dangerous Comanche warriors.

programme.title: Westward the Women
programme.desc: There's a deficit of good, honest women in the West, and Roy Whitman (John McIntire) wants to change that. His solution is to bring a caravan of over 100 mail-order brides from Chicago to California. It will be a long, difficult and dangerous journey for the women. So Whitman hires hardened, cynical Buck Wyatt (Robert Taylor) to be their guide across the inhospitable frontier. But as disaster strikes on the trail, Buck just might discover that these women are stronger than he thinks.

programme.title: Return of the Gunfighter
programme.desc: Ben Wyatt (Robert Taylor) is an aging gunfighter who has grown weary of his lifestyle. But when an old friend, Luis (Rodolfo Hoyos Jr.), asks for help defending his land, Ben can't say no. Unfortunately, he arrives too late, finding Luis and his entire family -- except daughter Anisa (Ana Martín) -- murdered. Ben is determined to get revenge against the killers, and in pursuing them reluctantly enlists the aid a younger gunfighter, Lee Sutton (Chad Everett).

programme.desc: When Becky helps Harris keep a secret from Darlene, it causes a split between the two sisters.

programme.desc: Darlene struggles to decide between David and Ben; Becky begins to doubt herself as a mom; Mark gets in trouble at school when a picture of him and his boyfriend kissing goes viral

programme.desc: Harris confronts Darlene's lifestyle; Jackie meddles in others' affairs to evade her own issues; Becky struggles with the expenses of parenthood, her family lends support.

programme.desc: Jackie and Becky pitch their business plan to Darlene in hopes of getting the Lunch Box back, but Darlene's decision leads to hostility among the three.

programme.desc: Thanksgiving chaos erupts as Dan gathers the family; tensions rise over the Lunch Box; Harris surprises everyone with a bold move.

programme.desc: Jackie’s faced with a tough decision that brings the family and community together.

programme.desc: Dan avoids grief until it confronts him; Ben and Darlene tackle baby fever; Dwight's nervous to fill in for an injured chef.

programme.desc: Dan connects with his half-brother but struggles with their father's unequal treatment; Jackie hits it off with a fun married couple.

programme.desc: Darlene joins Price Warehouse for income; Jackie advances her relationship with Ron and Janelle; Ben alters his appearance for advertisers.

programme.desc: Harris returns home newly-unemployed; Becky seeks childcare; Jackie advises reaching out to Emilio's family; the family ponders tattoos.

programme.desc: Darlene and Ben hunt for apartments; Jackie, Becky, and Beverly Rose road trip to Mexico to meet her father; Dan confides financial woes to Louise.

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S05:E12 - Episode 12

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S01:E01 - Episode 1

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's programme Gordon finds a chef caught in a time warp when he tackles a picturesque but largely unfrequented upmarket restaurant in King's Lynn, a traditional market town on the Norfolk coast. For the last eighteen months ex Michelin-starred chef Nick has owned and run Rococo but his past success is now eluding him. The menu is past its sell-by date, the service is stuffy, the food is over-priced and the only thing being fed is his ego. Yet, despite debts of ~£100k and the prospect of putting his home at risk and his young family on the streets, Nick continues to cook comatose in a 1990s fantasy land of his own making.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's final programme of the series Gordon grapples with girl power when he takes on an intimate family-run restaurant in the heart of WAG territory near Liverpool. For the last three years Morgan's has been run by antiques dealer-turned-restaurateur SANDY and her two daughters HELEN and LAURA. The beautifully-designed dining room has a prime high street location and should be the perfect eatery for the trendy local clientele. But Head Chef Phil is grappling with an eclectic menu that includes mashed potato with apricots and his cooking's just not up to it.

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S05:E07 - Episode 7

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S05:E09 - Episode 9

programme.title: Next Level Chef (UK)
programme.desc: Tonight in the Next Level Chef kitchen the 7 remaining chefs take on Fusion cooking, for a place in the Semi Final. There is a surprise visit from king of fusion himself, Big Zuu!

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don conducts a personal grand tour around Italy's magnificent gardens from the luxurious retreats of the moneyed north to the lavish hideaways of the romantic south. In this episode, he's in and around Rome, a powerbase of emperors and popes, to explore gardens that are among some of the most extravagant and flamboyant ever created in history.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is on a grand tour around Italy, this time visiting gardens both in Florence and around the sun-scorched Tuscan countryside. Monty discovers how, like a piece of sculpture, renaissance gardens were created as works of art, and how a group of Edwardian ex-pats mistakenly reinforced the idea that formal Italian gardens were flowerless.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don visits the iconic garden of impressionist painter Claude Monet at Giverny. As well as revelling in the beauty and colour of Monet's paradise at this time of year, he has a privileged chat to Englishman James Priest, who, just this week, took up his role as head gardener of this world-renowned garden. Back at Longmeadow Monty shares his top tips for growing key culinary herbs.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don's garden at Longmeadow is thriving in the summer sunshine and is looking more beautiful by the day, but the warm, wet weather has meant the hedges are growing like crazy and are in need of a good haircut.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty begins the process of taking out plants which are in the wrong place and either moving or dividing others. He also gives advice on making leaf mould from fallen leaves and how to use it.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don will be cutting back his delphiniums and adding a touch of the exotic to his Jewel Garden. Carol Klein is in Kent meeting lavender expert and breeder, Dr Simon Charlesworth, whose stunning walled garden is packed with many varieties of this beautifully scented plant.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets going on a new planting project, gives advice on planting for east- and west- facing borders, starts reaping summer vegetables and sows seeds for autumn harvests. Sue Kent finds inspiration for her own garden when she explores the glorious Aberglasney Gardens in Wales, while Nick Bailey travels to Scotland to investigate a disease which is affecting trees and shrubs in both woodlands and gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With autumn fast approaching, Monty is preparing the borders for the change of seasons and looking ahead to spring. Adam Frost and Advolly Richmond visit a glorious historic garden in North Yorkshire - Scampston Hall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team celebrate the wonder of trees and explore the vital role they play in gardens and the wider landscape. Zoe Ball joins Toby Buckland on a visit to a tree project in North London.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is back at Longmeadow, getting stuck into more seasonal tasks. Joe Swift heads to Houghton Lodge Gardens in Hampshire renowned for its walled kitchen garden and heritage fruit collection.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is preparing for spring colour as well as harvesting pumpkins and squashes. Carol Klein visits comedian Joe Lycett at home, and together, they plant up a container packed with layers of colourful bulbs. Toby Buckland visits Sue Kent's garden near Swansea to help out with autumnal maintenance.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and team share the best practical gardening advice, meet passionate plants-people up and down the country, and provide inspiration with visits to some of the UK's most remarkable gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Join the team as they present the seasonal highlights from across the country visiting stunning gardens, meeting the gardeners and finding out their secrets of success. Adam Frost presents from his garden and suggests essential gardening jobs for the weekend.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost adds tall plants for shady conditions to his borders, demonstrates how to make a window box for growing vegetables and herbs, and gives his tips on how to grow plants successfully in peat-free compost.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty turns his attention to containers, planting them up for drama and summer colour in the jewel garden and showing us how to repot citrus plants. In Hampshire, Joe Swift meets the designer of an award-winning contemporary garden to explore the techniques and the plants she has used to seamlessly integrate both house and garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty's focus is on summer when he plants up containers for colour in the Jewel Garden. He also turns his attention to overcrowded ornamental grasses which, now they are beginning to put on growth, need to be split and replanted. Continuing her search for finding the right plant for the right place, Carol takes a close look at why plants survive in the cracks and crevices of walls and gives her recommendations for garden plants that will thrive in similar conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the holiday season well and truly upon us, Monty shares some timely tips on how to make sure your garden doesn't suffer while you are away. But there are some gardeners that daren't leave home, as Joe Swift discovered when he met Phillip Vowles.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plans for next year's fruit harvest when he adds gooseberries to the fruit garden he planted earlier in the year. He also divides and moves herbaceous perennials and advises on the best bulbs to plant now for cut flowers next year. Frances Tophill meets a couple who have filled their garden with tender plants and devised a meticulous method of protecting them over the winter.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don's garden at Longmeadow is thriving in the summer sunshine and is looking more beautiful by the day, but the warm, wet weather has meant the hedges are growing like crazy and are in need of a good haircut.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein is in Hampshire with the great horticulturist, Roy Lancaster, appreciating the virtues of the often overlooked St John's wort. Joe Swift is out and about too and visits a very unusual allotment in Tottenham, North London.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is at Longmeadow, enjoying the colours of late summer in the garden. Adam Frost, Carol Klein and Frances Tophill get an exclusive preview of Gardeners' World Live at the NEC.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don demonstrates how to prepare for spring and summer with timely tasks in his damp garden and around the pond, and Joe Swift continues his series of master classes on planting design by sharing tips on how to create a tropical green oasis. Elsewhere, Carol Klein plants a viburnum that will give spring colour and fill her Devon garden with fragrance.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein and Joe Swift are at Gardeners' World Live in Birmingham. Joe will be casting an expert eye over the spectacular show gardens, while Carol will be focusing on the delights of the floral marquee.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: A celebration of the snowdrop, with a visit one of the world's largest collections, lovingly nurtured in a suburban back garden. Plus, Monty gives tips on what to do once they have finished flowering. Nick Bailey revels in the beauty of magnolias.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Arit Anderson and Frances Tophill visit Wakehurst, Kew's wild botanic garden in Sussex. They not only explore the gardens but also meet the gardeners, joining in on their planting projects and finding out more about the UK's largest conservation project, the Millenium Seed Bank.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don reveals plans for a new raised seating area, surrounded by wild flowers. Carol looks at the blossom at Battsford Arboretum in the Cotswolds and now the risk of frosts should have passed, Monty plants beans and courgettes in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: By the first week of June, plants are growing with such speed that some have a tendency to flop. Staking is the answer. As well as sharing his tips, Monty Don shows how to make stakes that can be used for many years to come. Now the nights are guaranteed to be frost free, Monty plants out the tender annuals he's raised from seed.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes a look at the use of pots and containers and revels in their versatility, practicality and potential and shows us how best to use them in our own gardens. Carol Klein returns to Stroud to see how the new gardeners are progressing.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the Wimbledon tennis championships just around the corner, Joe Swift meets the gardening team responsible for the spectacular floral displays at this world-renowned event.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's thoughts turn to spring when he gives recommendations for bulbs to plant that will thrive in pots. He also shows how to prune summer fruiting raspberries. In Norfolk, Frances Tophill visits a gardener who at 97 still gardens every day.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Whether there is a heatwave or a downpour, Monty has plenty of jobs to be getting on with from pruning, propagating or planting pots. Adam Frost meets Prince Charles in his garden at Highgrove to talk about the issue of biosecurity, an issue which is of great concern to him and which could have a big effect on our gardens and landscape. Adam also talks to The Prince's Head Forester to find out what gardeners can do to help.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don has left Longmeadow this week to explore the beautiful gardens at RHS Hyde Hall in Essex. He seeks inspiration from their amazing dry garden and discovers how they manage to keep their lawns looking pristine in such a hot summer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plans for next year's fruit harvest when he adds gooseberries to the fruit garden he planted earlier in the year. He also divides and moves herbaceous perennials and advises on the best bulbs to plant now for cut flowers next year. Frances Tophill meets a couple who have filled their garden with tender plants and devised a meticulous method of protecting them over the winter.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Pontiac Aztec and an Off-Road Dodge Caravan
programme.desc: Watch as Chip Foose attempts to tackle the design flaws of the often ridiculed Pontiac Aztek.Next, Chip thinks the original Dodge Caravan could use some performance and aesthetic upgrades and produces something... unexpected!

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Dusty Porsche 356 Speedster and an all-original Shelby GT500
programme.desc: In this episode of Barn Find Hunter, Tom Cotter talks with a woman with a dusty 1957 Porsche 356 A Speedster that she and her husband have owned since the 1960s. After that, Tom heads to his hometown and shows a stash of rare barn finds.

programme.title: Will It Run? | Barn Find 1970 Dodge Challenger
programme.desc: Davin Reckow attempts to bring a long-parked 1970 Dodge Challenger T/A 340 Six-Pack back to life.

programme.title: Dream Collections with Chris Jacobs | The Amazing Collections of Harley Cluxton and Tom Malloy
programme.desc: Chris Jacob tours two unbelievable car collections. His first stop is with Harley Cluxton where they drive a Gullwing Mercedes and a Gulf-livery Ford GT. Next, Chris dives into some Indy 500 history with Tom Malloy and his amazing collection.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Alfa Romeo GTV-6, a "K-Code" GT Mustang, and a Honda S2000
programme.desc: Colin Comer takes a look at a rust-free Alfa Romeo GTV-6, a "K-Code" Ford Mustang GT, and a 2004 Honda S2000 with only 80,0000 miles.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | 2025 Aston Martin Vantage and Bentley Continental GT
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole reviews latest Aston Martin Vantage, equipped with a powerful twin-turbo V-8. Next, Henry drives the Bentley Continental GT which, while losing it's legendary W-12 engine, still provides a ton of fun via a hybrid-enhanced turbo V-8.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Merkur, Ford and the XJ Jeep Cherokee
programme.desc: Revelations with Jason Cammisa feature untold stories of automotive legends. First, Jason tells the story of the Merkur XR4Ti and its Ford Sierra RS Cosworth cousin. Next, the Jeep Cherokee (XJ) takes center stage... as the best SUV ever?

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Renault R5 Turbo and Saab 900 Turbo

programme.desc: One Make gives an unfiltered look at what it’s like to be an up-and-coming driver in the Toyota Gazoo Racing North America GR Cup Series. This episode features Mia Lovell, Westin Workman, Lucas Weisenberg, and Henry Drury.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Broncos, Galaxies and a lifted Grand Wagoneer
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds all sorts of interesting vehicles on a trip to Northern Michigan, from Ford Broncos to a unique Ford Galaxie. Speaking of Galaxies, hang around for a look at a Galaxie 500 that is back on the road after being a "barn find" itself!

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | $900 Richard Petty engine, Ford Galaxies and a rare Mach 1 Mustang
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets "Snowball" Bishop, tours his personal junkyard, and gets some great stories about NASCAR and dirt track racing from the "good ol' days." Next, Tom gets the details on a rare Ford Mustang Mach 1 with a factory 429 Cobra Jet engine.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - VW Beetle, Classic Mini, and a USPS Mail Truck
programme.desc: Designer and hot rodder Chip Foose uses his incredible drawing and design abilities to rethink and re-imagine the looks of the Volkswagen Beetle, classic Austin Mini Cooper, and... a USPS mail truck?

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Caterham Super Seven 600 and a Famous Old Bentley
programme.desc: In part 1 of this episode of The Driver’s Seat, Henry Catchpole drives the new Caterham Super Seven 600. After that, he has the extraordinary opportunity to drive Eddie Hall's Derby Bentley. Eddie Hall was the only driver to ever complete the 24 Hour

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Millon-dollar barn find collection inherited by 3 sisters
programme.desc: Tom Cotter does what he does best: uses a barn find to learn about ANOTHER barn find! A unique LaSalle eventually leads to a $1,000,000 collection of 40 barn finds that 3 sisters just inherited from their recently passed father.

programme.desc: Tom Cotter introduces us to Steve and his insane collection of motorcycles. After that, Tom stumbles upon and interesting stash of Porsches.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | MST Mk1 Ford Escort and the Peugeot 205 GTI Tolman Edition
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole reviews the MST Mk1: Motorsport Tools' Ford Escort Mk1 restomod.Next, Henry jumps in another restomod, this time from Tolman Motorsport.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Z-Car, Countach, and XJ Jeep Cherokee
programme.desc: Chip Foose puts pen to paper and reimagines the designs of the Nissan Z, Lamborghini Countrach, and Jeep Cherokee (XJ).

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Oldsmobiles, Mopars, Pontiacs and Fords!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds Oldsmobile barn find heaven (with some Mopars and Pontiacs sprinkled in for good measure). After that, Tom stumbles upon a 1970 Shelby Mustang GT500 buried in a garage, but in amazing condition.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Porsche Stories: The new 911 GT3 and wild history of the 924
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa argues why the Porsche GT3 is now, unquestionably, the most important car in the 911 lineup.Next, Jason explores the wild history of the Porsche 924 and why it was never meant to be a Porsche.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Classic Fords, Chevys and some dusty Italian sports cars!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds himself in Michigan again where he comes upon a pole barn full of Chevys and Fords that owner Denny has all sorts of stories about. Tom then heads to the other end of the state for some European sports car barn finds.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | AMG GT on Mercedes Secret Test Track, plus the new Porsche 911
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole heads to Mercedes' secret test track to drive and review the newest AMG GT. After that, Henry jumps in the new HYBRID Porsche 911 GTS (992.2) and wonders if the added weight will adversely affect the legendary nameplate.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Pizzas and Sports Cars, and IROC Lives Again!
programme.desc: In this episode of Barn Find Hunter, Tom Cotter meets a gentlemen who's pizza business allowed him to collect a stockpile of European sports cars. Next, Tom meets up with Ray Evernham at the re-launch of the IROC race series.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Mitsubishi EVO 5, and Secret Car Collections
programme.desc: Larry Chen travels to Indonesia and discovers a unique twin-charged, 600HP Mitsubishi EVO 5. After that, Larry heads to Singapore to check out its vibrant car culture and explore a secret collection of cars spread across several properties.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - '32 Ford and Volvo Amazon
programme.desc: Chip Foose sits down to draw and share his thoughts on how the 1932 Ford Model B design is still relevant today.Next, Chip tweaks the design of a lesser-known European classic: the Volvo Amazon.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Pontiac Aztec and an Off-Road Dodge Caravan
programme.desc: Watch as Chip Foose attempts to tackle the design flaws of the often ridiculed Pontiac Aztek.Next, Chip thinks the original Dodge Caravan could use some performance and aesthetic upgrades and produces something... unexpected!

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Dusty Porsche 356 Speedster and an all-original Shelby GT500
programme.desc: In this episode of Barn Find Hunter, Tom Cotter talks with a woman with a dusty 1957 Porsche 356 A Speedster that she and her husband have owned since the 1960s. After that, Tom heads to his hometown and shows a stash of rare barn finds.

programme.title: Will It Run? | Barn Find 1970 Dodge Challenger
programme.desc: Davin Reckow attempts to bring a long-parked 1970 Dodge Challenger T/A 340 Six-Pack back to life.

programme.title: Dream Collections with Chris Jacobs | The Amazing Collections of Harley Cluxton and Tom Malloy
programme.desc: Chris Jacob tours two unbelievable car collections. His first stop is with Harley Cluxton where they drive a Gullwing Mercedes and a Gulf-livery Ford GT. Next, Chris dives into some Indy 500 history with Tom Malloy and his amazing collection.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Alfa Romeo GTV-6, a "K-Code" GT Mustang, and a Honda S2000
programme.desc: Colin Comer takes a look at a rust-free Alfa Romeo GTV-6, a "K-Code" Ford Mustang GT, and a 2004 Honda S2000 with only 80,0000 miles.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | 2025 Aston Martin Vantage and Bentley Continental GT
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole reviews latest Aston Martin Vantage, equipped with a powerful twin-turbo V-8. Next, Henry drives the Bentley Continental GT which, while losing it's legendary W-12 engine, still provides a ton of fun via a hybrid-enhanced turbo V-8.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Merkur, Ford and the XJ Jeep Cherokee
programme.desc: Revelations with Jason Cammisa feature untold stories of automotive legends. First, Jason tells the story of the Merkur XR4Ti and its Ford Sierra RS Cosworth cousin. Next, the Jeep Cherokee (XJ) takes center stage... as the best SUV ever?

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Renault R5 Turbo and Saab 900 Turbo
programme.desc: Early turbo cars! In this episode of Revelations, host Jason Cammisa tells us the unique stories behind the Renault R5 Turbo, and the Saab 900 Turbo.

programme.title: One Make: Rising Stars in the Racing World | Presented by Mobil 1
programme.desc: One Make gives an unfiltered look at what it’s like to be an up-and-coming driver in the Toyota Gazoo Racing North America GR Cup Series. This episode features Mia Lovell, Westin Workman, Lucas Weisenberg, and Henry Drury.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Broncos, Galaxies and a lifted Grand Wagoneer
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds all sorts of interesting vehicles on a trip to Northern Michigan, from Ford Broncos to a unique Ford Galaxie. Speaking of Galaxies, hang around for a look at a Galaxie 500 that is back on the road after being a "barn find" itself!

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | $900 Richard Petty engine, Ford Galaxies and a rare Mach 1 Mustang
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets "Snowball" Bishop, tours his personal junkyard, and gets some great stories about NASCAR and dirt track racing from the "good ol' days." Next, Tom gets the details on a rare Ford Mustang Mach 1 with a factory 429 Cobra Jet engine.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - VW Beetle, Classic Mini, and a USPS Mail Truck
programme.desc: Designer and hot rodder Chip Foose uses his incredible drawing and design abilities to rethink and re-imagine the looks of the Volkswagen Beetle, classic Austin Mini Cooper, and... a USPS mail truck?

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Caterham Super Seven 600 and a Famous Old Bentley
programme.desc: In part 1 of this episode of The Driver’s Seat, Henry Catchpole drives the new Caterham Super Seven 600. After that, he has the extraordinary opportunity to drive Eddie Hall's Derby Bentley. Eddie Hall was the only driver to ever complete the 24 Hour

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Millon-dollar barn find collection inherited by 3 sisters
programme.desc: Tom Cotter does what he does best: uses a barn find to learn about ANOTHER barn find! A unique LaSalle eventually leads to a $1,000,000 collection of 40 barn finds that 3 sisters just inherited from their recently passed father.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 5000 motorcycles? Plus, a plethora of Porsches
programme.desc: Tom Cotter introduces us to Steve and his insane collection of motorcycles. After that, Tom stumbles upon and interesting stash of Porsches.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Ferrari Dino, AMC Javelin, Buicks and Alfas
programme.desc: With the help of a friend, Tom discovers a cache of rare and forgotten cars hidden away in Virginia. Next, Tom visits two other friends to check out their interesting collections of cars.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The stories behind the Ford GT and original Ford Bronco
programme.desc: Jason Cammisa tells the fascinating backstory of the 2005-2006 Ford GT.Next, Jason tells the story of the Ford Bronco, from the first generation to the current model.

programme.title: ICONS with Jason Cammisa | All things Ford Bronco Raptor
programme.desc: In part 1 of this Ford Bronco Raptor special, host Jason Cammisa dives into the nitty gritty details of the highly capable Ford Bronco Raptor. Next, he drag races it against some very interesting competition.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | De Tomaso Pantera locked in trailer for 35 years
programme.desc: Tom Cotter opens up an old trailer to reveal a 1972 De Tomaso Pantera that had been stored there for 35 years. A few years later, we follow up with the gentlemen who bought and fully restored to car.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | The World's Quickest Cars
programme.desc: Lucid Air Sapphire vs. Bugatti Chiron Pur Sport vs. Tesla Model S PlaidLucid Air Dream Edition vs. Tesla Model S Plaid vs. BMW E39 M5 vs... a skydiver?Genesis GV60 vs. BMW iX xDrive50 vs. Ford Mustang Mach-E GT Performance vs. Tesla Model Y

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture with Larry Chen | Amazing JDM cars in Thailand and Japan
programme.desc: Larry Chen travels to Thailand to explore a mansion filled with legendary JDM cars. After that, Larry heads to Japan and the Fuji Speedway to see two amazing Nissan R34 GT-Rs built by Mines and Built By Legends.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Private tour of Collier Motors, an abandoned car dealership
programme.desc: Tom Cotter gets a private tour of Collier Motors, an AMC dealership that was abandoned 40 years ago. Next, Tom is in Maine where he finds an LS-swapped Rolls Royce, Plymouth Barracuda, and a unique Harley Davidson.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | The World's Best-Sounding Drag Race
programme.desc: Lexus LFA vs Porsche Carrera GT vs Audi RS3The World's Heaviest Supercars square off in this episode of Ultimate Drag Race Replay - with the brand-new, 700-hp Ford F-150 Raptor R racing everything it can.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Liberty Walk Ferrari F40, Tokyo Drift IRL
programme.desc: Larry Chen heads to Japan to check out Libery Walk's "blasphemous" Ferrari F40 custom build. Next, Larry explores the not-so-secret underground car meet right after the Tokyo Auto Salon.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | McLaren P1 Spider and 750 S Reviews
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews a one-off McLaren P1 Spider and the new McLaren 750 S.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Stories Behind Mazda's Miata and RX-7
programme.desc: The unlikely success story of the Mazda MX-5 Miata: the world's bestselling 2-seat roadster and the only remaining true lightweight sports car.The 3rd-gen Mazda RX-7 has it all: beauty, performance, a Le Mans tie-in, and a sales failure.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Turner's Auto Wrecking and hidden Porsche 356
programme.desc: In this episode of Barn Find Hunter, Tom Cotter gets exclusive access to Turner's Auto Wrecking in Fresno, California. After that, he heads high up in the Rocky Mountains of Colorado to discover a Porsche 356 and more.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Porsche Taycan GTS & Volkswagen ID. Buzz Review
programme.desc: Henry drives not one but two Porsches with a GTS badge on the back… and one will surprise you.Next, Henry jumps into the new Volkswagen ID. Buzz van and makes an attempt to turn it into a weekend camper.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Old race car, V8-powered Supra, hot rod Mustang and more!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets a gentlemen with 1937 Riley Lynx with a unique racing history. After that, Tom meets a whole family who are into unique "modern classics."

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Tri-power Olds Super 88 and forgotten cars must GO!
programme.desc: Tom teams up with Davin Reckow, from our "Redline Rebuild" series, to unearth a large collection of forgotten classics, including an Oldsmobile Super 88 that gets a second lease on life after it's purchase and restored by a Barn Find Hunter viewer!

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Inherited barn find collection and a wild fiberglass coupe
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets two brothers who just inherited a lifetime collection of eclectic cars. After that, Tom finds an extremely unique fiberglass coupe that once ran on "half of a Deusenberg" engine.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Aspen F.A.T. Ice Race and a Review of the Audi R8 GT RWD
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole takes us to the F.A.T. Ice Race in Aspen, CO, which must be the coolest car event on the planet. Next, Henry jumps in what could be the last ever V10-powered Audi R8.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | World's Fastest V-8 Wagons & Sedans! Plus: 1000+ HP "Mom Missiles"
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Jason Cammisa drag races the world's fastest V-8 wagons and sedans. Next, it's a "Mom Missile" showdown as Jason races 6 of the world's quickest SUVs, including the Gen-2 Rivian R1S Quad, Lucid Gravity Dream Edition and more!

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Datsun 240Z and Porsche 911 Restomods
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole goes for a drive in MZR Roadsports Datsun 240Z restomod followed by an outing in Workshop 5001's amazing Porsche 911 restomod.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Autozam AZ-1, Honda Beat, Suzuki Cappuccino, and Honda S500
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa explores the history of the legendary "A-B-C" Kei Cars. To wrap things up, he dives into the story of Honda's first-ever passenger car, the S500.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Spotting cars from an airplane
programme.desc: Tom Cotter rides shotgun in a small airplane in an attempt to spot old cars that would otherwise be hidden from view.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat w/ Henry Catchpole - The Rocketeer MX-V6 and new Renault 5 E-Tech
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole drives the incredible Rocketeer MX-V6, a naturally aspirated, V-6 powered Mazda MX-5 Miata restomod. Next, Henry jumps in the new Renault 5 E-Tech: an affordable, fun EV for the masses?

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Hong Kong's Underground Car Scene, and Nissan Hyper Force
programme.desc: Larry Chen checks out Hong Kong's underground car scene. Next, Larry gets the inside scoop on the newly revealed Nissan Hyper Force concept electric hyper-car.

programme.title: The Appraiser | All about Ford Mustangs!
programme.desc: Colin Comer appraises a trio of interesting Ford Mustangs. A 1993 Ford SVT Cobra, 1966 Shelby GT350 Hertz edition, and a 1966 Mustang with 350,000 miles on the odometer!

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | RARE Hertz Shelby GT350, European Classics, and an all-original Datusn 240Z
programme.desc: Tom Cotter uncovers a rare Hertz Shelby GT350. Next, he explores an abandoned mine full of Porsches, Alfa Romeos and BMWs. Lastly, Tom talks with the owner of Datsun 240Z #00021 that sits in its original, unrestored condition.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Muscle Car Dreamland and Elvis' Lincoln Continental
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds a stash of muscle cars in Georgia before discovering an interesting Lincoln Continental that possibly belonged to Elvis Presley.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | The greatest barn find collection of all time
programme.desc: In this episode of Barn Find Hunter, Tom Cotter meets Billy Eubanks and is unbelievable collection of cars stored in various hand-built garages and structures around his property. It is a truly amazing stash of vehicles!

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | BMW M4 CSL and Range Rover Sport SV Reviews
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the new BMW M4 CSL and the track-ready Range Rover Sport SV.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Toyota 2000GT and Nissan 240Z
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, host Jason Cammisa dives into the story of Toyota's 2000GT, which was one of the fastest cars in history. Next, Jason gives us the fascinating history behind the Datsun (Nissan) 240Z.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | RARE Hertz Shelby GT350, European Classics, and an all-original Datusn 240Z
programme.desc: Tom Cotter uncovers a rare Hertz Shelby GT350. Next, he explores an abandoned mine full of Porsches, Alfa Romeos and BMWs. Lastly, Tom talks with the owner of Datsun 240Z #00021 that sits in its original, unrestored condition.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: On opening day of Missouri’s gun season, hunters from around the state seek ridges and box blinds throughout the “Show Me” state in search of mature whitetail bucks. programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson finishes the South America Waterfowl Slam in the Andes at 15,000 feet elevation. programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: The team breaks down how, when, and where to create mock scrapes to attract and inventory mature bucks on your hunting property. From the science behind licking branches to choosing the perfect locations and using trail cameras to monitor activity, this episode is packed with practical tips that any hunter can use.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Dan Schmidt sits down with Auburn University professor Dr. Steve Ditchkoff to tackle one of the most debated topics in deer management: cull bucks. Is there real science behind the idea of removing “inferior” bucks to improve herd genetics, or is it more myth than management?

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: In this special 20th-anniversary episode, "Deer & Deer Hunting TV" takes a nostalgic journey through two decades of hunting television. Hosts Dan Schmidt and Brad Rucks lead viewers through memorable moments.

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: his week, I welcome back Capt. Neill Holland of Ocean Aid 360! Ocean Aid 360 along with Reef Relief, Surfrider, CCA, Beach Weekend, FWC, and NOAA, are leading a THREE DAY marine debris cleanup event that spans four hours each day, featuring daily raffle prizes, free lunches, and swag bags. They are inviting walkers, boaters, kayakers, and paddlers to join forces for a much-needed cleanup of the area. You can participate for one day or all three! Not only will you have a chance to WIN major prizes through daily raffles, but you'll also be contributing to the preservation of marine habitats and wildlife.The event starts 9/13/23 and ends 9/15/23. You can learn more and join this clean up here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/key-haven-coastal-community-cleanup-tickets-709576130307?aff=ebdsoporgprofileAt Ocean Aid 360, the belief is clear: environmental preservation and the livelihoods of marine-dependent communities are inseparable. Captain Neill Holland, a St. Pete, Florida native with a rich background in marine conservation, shares his journey from a career at National Geographic magazine to leading this impactful non-profit.Tune in to gain insights into the remarkable work of Ocean Aid 360 and Captain Neill Holland's dedication to the preservation of our marine ecosystems. It's an episode filled with hope, innovation, and a shared vision of a brighter future for our oceans.Follow Capt Neill on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/gofishtampabay/Follow OCEAN AID 360 on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/oceanaid360https://www.oceanaid360.orghttps://www.gofishtampabay.com#MarineConservation #OceanAid360 #MarineDebrisCleanup #CommunityCleanup #CleanOceans #EnvironmentalStewardship #MarineHabitat #VolunteerForChange #SaveOurSeas #EcoFriendly #WildlifeProtection #SustainableLiving #ProtectTheOcean #RafflePrizes #BeachCleanup #ConservationHeroes #EnvironmentalPartnerships #OceanProtection #CoastalCleanup #CleanerOceans #TeamSeasWEBSITES:http://www.saltwaterexperience.comhttp://www.tomrowlandpodcast.comSTREAM ALL OUR FULL SEASONS ON WAYPOINT TV: http://waypointtv.com/#!/saltwaterexperience

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: Across the country, deer season to many Americans is a rite of passage. For generations, Winchester has been the trusted ammunition choice for hunters…and it’s been a decade since the game-changing Deer Season XP whitetail line was introduced. In this episode, we’ll celebrate the many successes by Team Winchester hunters in the field during whitetail and mule deer firearm seasons across the United States. GUESTS: Melissa Bachman (Team Winchester) Mark Drury (Team Winchester) Nikki Boxler (Team Winchester) Chris Keefer (Team Winchester) Casey Keefer (Team Winchester) Jason Gilbertson (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: The mission of Shoot United is to be a content resource for millions of shooters and a place where people can learn, build confidence and find ways to participate. Through films, educational videos and articles, SU has impacted countless shooters all over the world. In this episode, join Shoot United Ambassadors as they inspire and educate through a series of instructional videos and stories in pistol, self-defense, trap and skeet and sporting clays. GUESTS: Thea Van Sync (Team Winchester) Callie Farill (Team Winchester) Becky Yackley (Team Winchester) Theo Ribbs (Team Winchester) Jessica Hook (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: The team breaks down how, when, and where to create mock scrapes to attract and inventory mature bucks on your hunting property. programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Dan Schmidt sits down with Auburn University professor Dr. Steve Ditchkoff to tackle one of the most debated topics in deer management: cull bucks. Is there real science behind the idea of removing “inferior” bucks to improve herd genetics, or is it more myth than management?

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: his week, I welcome back Capt. Neill Holland of Ocean Aid 360! Ocean Aid 360 along with Reef Relief, Surfrider, CCA, Beach Weekend, FWC, and NOAA, are leading a THREE DAY marine debris cleanup event that spans four hours each day, featuring daily raffle prizes, free lunches, and swag bags. They are inviting walkers, boaters, kayakers, and paddlers to join forces for a much-needed cleanup of the area. You can participate for one day or all three! Not only will you have a chance to WIN major prizes through daily raffles, but you'll also be contributing to the preservation of marine habitats and wildlife.The event starts 9/13/23 and ends 9/15/23. You can learn more and join this clean up here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/key-haven-coastal-community-cleanup-tickets-709576130307?aff=ebdsoporgprofileAt Ocean Aid 360, the belief is clear: environmental preservation and the livelihoods of marine-dependent communities are inseparable. Captain Neill Holland, a St. Pete, Florida native with a rich background in marine conservation, shares his journey from a career at National Geographic magazine to leading this impactful non-profit.Tune in to gain insights into the remarkable work of Ocean Aid 360 and Captain Neill Holland's dedication to the preservation of our marine ecosystems. It's an episode filled with hope, innovation, and a shared vision of a brighter future for our oceans.Follow Capt Neill on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/gofishtampabay/Follow OCEAN AID 360 on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/oceanaid360https://www.oceanaid360.orghttps://www.gofishtampabay.com#MarineConservation #OceanAid360 #MarineDebrisCleanup #CommunityCleanup #CleanOceans #EnvironmentalStewardship #MarineHabitat #VolunteerForChange #SaveOurSeas #EcoFriendly #WildlifeProtection #SustainableLiving #ProtectTheOcean #RafflePrizes #BeachCleanup #ConservationHeroes #EnvironmentalPartnerships #OceanProtection #CoastalCleanup #CleanerOceans #TeamSeasWEBSITES:http://www.saltwaterexperience.comhttp://www.tomrowlandpodcast.comSTREAM ALL OUR FULL SEASONS ON WAYPOINT TV: http://waypointtv.com/#!/saltwaterexperience

When the murder weapon is found to be one of the brushes Red sells, he must fight to prove his innocence.

programme.title: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner

programme.title: Mr. Deeds Goes to Town
programme.desc: Longfellow Deeds (Gary Cooper), a resident of small-town Vermont, leads a simple life until he inherits a vast fortune from a late uncle. Soon, unscrupulous lawyer John Cedar (Douglas Dumbrille) brings Deeds to New York City, where the unassuming heir is the object of much media attention. When wily reporter Babe Bennett (Jean Arthur) gains the trust and affection of Deeds, she uses her position to publish condescending articles about him -- but are her feelings for him really that shallow?

programme.title: The Three Stooges in Orbit

programme.title: The Whole Truth

programme.title: You Were Never Lovelier
programme.desc: Bob Davis (Fred Astaire), an American dancer in Buenos Aires, Argentina, finds himself desperate for work after losing all his money. He takes a gig at a wedding, hoping to impress the bride's father, Eduardo Acuña (Adolphe Menjou), a local club owner who has decreed that his daughters must marry in order of age. Eduardo eventually agrees to allow Bob to perform at his club, but only under the condition that he play suitor to his second-oldest daughter, the beautiful Maria (Rita Hayworth).

programme.title: Under the Yum-Yum Tree
programme.desc: The machinations of a lusty landlord threaten the bliss of a couple trying to determine their character compatibility by living together platonically.

programme.title: Mr. Deeds Goes to Town
programme.desc: Longfellow Deeds (Gary Cooper), a resident of small-town Vermont, leads a simple life until he inherits a vast fortune from a late uncle. Soon, unscrupulous lawyer John Cedar (Douglas Dumbrille) brings Deeds to New York City, where the unassuming heir is the object of much media attention. When wily reporter Babe Bennett (Jean Arthur) gains the trust and affection of Deeds, she uses her position to publish condescending articles about him -- but are her feelings for him really that shallow?

programme.title: Guess Who's Coming to Dinner
programme.desc: A daughter visits her family to introduce them to her Black fiancé, whose kindness and loving demeanor changes the hearts of her reluctant parents.

programme.title: Arizona
programme.desc: Phoebe Titus (Jean Arthur) is a tough-as-nails pioneer with dreams of starting a freight service in Tuscon, Ariz. Peter Muncie (William Holden), a vagabond passing through Arizona en route to California, takes a romantic interest in Phoebe and coaxes out her softer side. Just as their romance begins to blossom, Peter packs up and moves on. Though charming southerner Jefferson Carteret (Warren William) steps in to lend a hand, he may be plotting in secret to sabotage Phoebe's nascent business.

programme.title: Face of a Fugitive
programme.desc: While being escorted to jail, bank robber Jim Larson (Fred MacMurray) manages to get the upper hand on his captor and escape. Jim is surprised to see his brother appear on the scene, ready to aid his sibling. As they make their getaway, his brother and the pursuing lawman shoot each other, leaving the stunned Jim alone and on the run. Assuming a different identity, Jim travels to a mining town and befriends the local sheriff (Lin McCarthy), hoping to start over and find redemption.

programme.title: Ambush at Tomahawk Gap

programme.title: Man in the Saddle

programme.title: 7th Cavalry
programme.desc: Returning to Fort Lincoln, Capt. Benson learns of Custer's defeat at the Little Big Horn. At the inquiry as Custer's officers blame Custer for the defeat, Benson tries to defend him. However, Benson was suspiciously absent at the time of the battle and is now despised by the troops. So when an order to retrieve the bodies from the battlefield arrives, Benson volunteers for the dangerous mission of returning back into Indian territory.

programme.title: The Parson and the Outlaw
programme.desc: Billy the Kid (Anthony Dexter) retires from the outlaw life, fakes his own death and adopts the name William Bonney. Soon, William runs into Jack Slade (Sonny Tufts), a gun-toting stranger who is itching for a gunfight. Jack falls in with a group of thugs terrorizing William's town. The Rev. Jericho Jones (Buddy Rogers) exhorts William to defend the townspeople, and, when William's maid, Tonya (Marie Windsor), is beaten by the thugs, he grabs his pistol.

programme.title: The Great Sioux Massacre

programme.title: Ride Lonesome
programme.desc: A bounty hunter escorts a killer to prison but allows his outlaw brother to catch up with them to have a showdown over a previous shocking murder.

programme.title: Up the MacGregors
programme.desc: Gregor MacGregor (David Bailey) is celebrating his upcoming marriage to Rosita Carson (Agata Flori) when bandits, led by the evil Maldonado (Leo Anchóriz), steal the family fortune. Determined to get their money back, Gregor and his six brothers go after the robbers. They run across a dentist and his beautiful daughter, who help them find the gang's hideout and retrieve their cash -- but then Maldonado takes Rosita hostage in retaliation. When Gregor comes to save her, he is also captured.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a real estate agent whose body was found in the walls of one of his listings; Danny's mother visits with unexpected news.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A murder investigation leads the team to uncover a possible terrorist cell planning an attack on U.S. soil.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Catherine and McGarrett go to Afghanistan to help a young boy, whose family saved Catherine years earlier.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Grover is forced to steal $100 million when a nemesis kidnaps his daughter; Wo Fat goes back to Oahu after escaping from prison.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the annual Thassingham Classical Music Festival draws in big audiences, several musicians anxiously compete for the coveted Falconer Bursary Award. When the winner is brutally murdered and a priceless violin stolen, Barnaby and Winter's investigations lead them deep into a world haunted by a potentially deadly curse.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The appearance of a headless horseman at Quitewell Hall foreshadows a number of deaths amongst an aristocratic family. In the midst of a Civil War re-enactment the family relive their own historic battles with their hostile neighbours. But what is the truth about the DeQuettevilles - and the ghostly rider?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a barrister is killed in Midsomer, suspicion falls on convicted murderer Grady Felton. Grady has just returned to the village where he committed the murder years ago amid much anger from locals. But Grady has a solid alibi. Barnaby suspects he is working with an accomplice - until Grady himself is targeted in an arson attack.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The murder of a journalist has chilling echoes of a 1960s horror film starring Midsomer's own Stella Harris. When Stella's more famous sister returns after a 40-year family rift, the killings escalate, each of them reminiscent of a movie plot. Is life - and death - imitating art?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As darkness covers Midsomer Stanton during a total eclipse of the sun, amateur astronomer Jeremy Harper is killed by a blow to the head with a meteorite. Barnaby and Jones soon discover intrigue, sexual tension and academic rivalry are rife among the star-seeking community.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Harriet Farmer wakes up after being in a coma since the night she tried to elope. Soon afterwards, a killer strikes members of a chess club. Could the attack which left Harriet for dead a year ago be linked to moves on a chess board? And where is her boyfriend Finn?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A woman is crushed to death with a giant round of cheese at the home of the world-famous Midsomer Blue. Secret and controversial plans to modernise the dairy are revealed while rumours about private lives of the parents cause a row at the prestigious local prep school. As other people linked to the dairy meet agonising deaths, long-held secrets start to emerge...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Midsomer is buzzing with excitement at the arrival of the annual ‘Paramount Dance Extravaganza’. But behind the sequins and smiles are deep running feuds and passions.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Prolific real estate agent Alexander Beauvoisin is murdered in front of a crowd at the unveiling of a new dolls house collection at Midsomer Museum of the family.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Deddington’s thriving bee Empire has put Granville Norton on the map, but what lengths will they go to to ensure they’re never dethroned…

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Fishermen and women flock to the village of Solomon Gorge desperate to catch a giant fish that is said to lurk in the lake.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the Barnabys prepare for Cully's wedding, Lord Fitzroy and Beth Porteous are married in the pretty village of Bledlow. At the lavish reception at Bledlow Hall that follows, however, tragedy strikes - maid of honour Marina Fellowes is found murdered in one of the rooms by some of the guests. With their honeymoon cancelled, the Fitzroys must contend with a police presence in their home, as Barnaby and Jones try to learn more about the family history. It soon becomes clear there are secrets, deception, and an illegtimate son involved in the mystery, which is further complicated when the estate manager is killed by an arrow.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: It's a good day for the Hicks family, as the name of Tommy Hicks - who was executed during World War I for "cowardice and desertion" - is added to the list on Midsomer Parva's war memorial. Tommy's son Lionel and grandson Dave, mayor of Causton and whom Barnaby does not like (owing to dodgy building work by the mayor's company), are thrilled, but the snooty Hammonds are decidedly less pleased. Henry, the patriarch of the Hammond family, is particularly riled by his insalubrious neighbours, and has nurtured a long-running feud with the Hickses. But the evening after a battle re-enactment in the village, Henry is murdered - and Barnaby must delve into the history of the two families to find the killer, discovering a web of fraud, lies, and hidden truths.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones are in Dunstan to investigate the deaths of a reclusive couple. As they try to establish whether Ron and Libby Wilson were murdered or died of natural causes, their attention is drawn to a dispute raging between a local builder and road protesters nearby. When another death occurs, the detectives learn that there are plenty of dark secrets and fierce hostilities in this apparently idyllic village. Will Jack Purdy's quick temper lead to violence? How far would the protesters go to prevent the bypass being built? And do current events somehow relate to the death of Michael Wilson many years earlier?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the body of Londoner Charlie Finleyson is discovered in woodland near Midsomer Sonning, Barnaby and Jones find themselves investigating employees at local Midsomer Life magazine. It turns out the dead man was married to the ex-wife of Guy Sandys, the wealthy owner of the publication. As the detectives become aware of a feud between Guy and the proprietor of the Morecroft Hotel, tensions are also heating up between the locals and visiting Londoners. Soon Barnaby and Jones find themselves to trying to piece together the truth about the murder, and learn that someone might be trying to conceal something in their past.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a pub landlady is crushed to death during a magic show in Midsomer Oaks, Barnaby and Nelson uncover conflict between the village church and ancient pagan traditions. Is famous magician Gideon Latimer to blame or is he the target?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones are forced to take part in a team building exercise and Tom has plenty of problems dealing with the young, new, acting Chief Superintendent, John Cotton (Nick Fletcher). Following an explosion in a truck that had been stored in a truck depot, a body is soon discovered in a nearby lake, which turns out to be Alec Grainger, who had been seen arguing with James Parkes (Joseph Millson), the son of Colonel Matt Parkes (Tim Pigott-Smith). James appears to be involved in shady business deals and is blamed by his grandmother Caroline Halsey (Judy Parfitt) - and others - for the suicide of a woman he got pregnant two years before. Barnaby and Jones find themselves delving into a mixture of fraud, smuggling, and lies, trying to piece together the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When two couples vanish into thin air in the village of Monks Barton, Barnaby and Jones hear rumours of haunted woods and witchcraft. Barnaby remains sceptical of this, even when an unidentified body is found in a shallow grave and the missing start turning up dead. He soon has to determine if ghosts, criminals, or something else, is behind the abductions and murders.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The residents of Milton Cross, a feudal estate with a church, farms, houses and acres of land, depend on lord of the manor Edward Milton for their livelihoods. But when Sonia Woodley is stabbed in the churchyard two years after the death of her abusive husband Gerald, Barnaby and Jones investigate, trying to work out who killed her. It soon becomes clear someone took a pair of tailor scissors to do the deed, but who amongst the villagers could have done so, is unclear, and the investigation is complicated, when the pair learn the local Anglican priest, the parish vicar, had received a letter from Sonia. When he himself is killed, the pair believe something in the letter may be key to solving the mystery.

programme.title: Misterios Sin Revolver
programme.desc: Este episodio incluye: Tragedia Adolescente, Jim y Tammi, Asesinato en el Departamento de Estado y Excavaciones de Adams Perdidas.

programme.title: Misterios Sin Revolver
programme.desc: Este episodio incluye: Oro de Tontos, Actualización: Secuestro de Bebé en Baltimore, Suicidio Homicidio, Corredor de Bebés y Donald Eugene Webb.

programme.title: Johnny Cash: The Man in Black
programme.desc: John Cash was one of the most accomplished and influential artists of the 20th century. But his story of success was also one of internal struggle.

programme.title: Willie Nelson: Highs and Lows
programme.desc: With an unorthodox approach to country music, Willie Nelson helped spearhead the genre's outlaw movement and became a figure of 1970s counterculture.

programme.title: Wynonna Judd: Love Is Alive
programme.desc: Wynonna Judd hits the heights of music stardom two times and finds love with an unlikely soul mate; chronicling her multiple ascents to stardom and delving into her story with her music being made her way.

programme.title: Johnny Cash: Road to Redemption
programme.desc: With his once-promising career a hazy memory, the Man in Black looks to turn it around with a risky live album recorded at California’s Folsom Prison.

programme.title: Tom Petty: Won't Back Down
programme.desc: His voice is something that wouldn't even pass a first audition on "American Idol," yet today he is recognized as one of rock's greatest singer-songwriters.

programme.title: Jon Bon Jovi: Frontman
programme.desc: For almost 40 years Jon Bon Jovi has fronted one of the world's biggest rock bands, Bon Jovi. With hits like "Livin' On A Prayer" and "Bad Medicine," their album sales topped 130 million. Jon Bon Jovi is equally successful as a solo artist and actor.

programme.title: Breaking the Band
programme.desc: German heavy metal band Scorpions is one of the most successful international rock bands.

programme.title: Journey: A Voice Lost and Found
programme.desc: Delve into interviews with close associates, friends, and media experts as they unveil the narrative behind the band's remarkable rise to fame.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Gabe Rygaard takes on the toughest challenge of his career; Papac Alaska goes to a remote, mountainous island to tackle the biggest job in the company's history; Greg Chapman starts on a quest to find a lost logging train.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Rygaard crew batles Mother Nature as temperatures climb; Joe is still reeling from his injury; Greg Chapman pulls an extremely rare double barrel log from the St John's River.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Gabe has to call upon his son Aidan to step up and fill the family shoes; an overcrowded landing means one wrong move could wipe out the Papac crew below; Greg's quest to find the Lost Log Train is back on track.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: In Washington, production's rising with the newest generation of Rygaard on the job; David Zitterkopf is back in action with his son Levi to take on their biggest; Papac's new unit puts the crew to the ultimate test.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The Rygaard crew gets a surprise visit from logging legend Craig Rygaard; the Zitterkopfs face a major obstacle in their push to complete their largest ever job; Papac battles the Longest Yard unit with its mile long skyline.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Rygaard Logging is trying to get back on track with the help of patriarch Craig Rygaard; the Swampman's under the gun to build an emergency treetop storm shelter; David Zitterkopf's son Levi gets a crucial lesson in logging.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Gabe Rygaard pushes his crew to a breaking point; Gary and Eddie blow up their business to cash in on green gold; David Zitterkopf could see his family empire fall to pieces, with one wrong move; a mutiny is underway among the Chapman crew.

programme.desc: Mike Papac has to step in as Joe and Coatsey's arguments threaten to bring the job to a grinding halt; David Zitterkopf's back to work after an injury that threatened to end his season.

programme.desc: Papac Logging is barely holding onto their lead; the Rygaards will have to work as a team if they're gonna reclaim the title; Shelby Stanga's under the gun, but has a secret map to a possible stash of sunken logs.

programme.title: Texas Metal

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The team revamps an old school '34 Buick into a modern day lowrider; after months of rebuilding the body and making a custom frame for Earl Campbell's '49 Cadillac, the Hall of Famer challenges the shop with a last-minute wrinkle.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's the 18th day of the ice road season and truckers have delivered more than 3000 loads to the diamond mines. The temperatures are dropping, the loads are getting heavier.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's half way through the grueling ice road season. Six hundred truckers have ferried more than 4,000 loads to the northern mines.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Truckers have hauled more than 100,000 tons of supplies in temperatures of forty degrees below zero, but accidents and strict safety regulations have sent many drivers packing.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's just over a month into the new ice road season and more than 800 truckers are on the ice, working around the clock.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's day 37 of the ice road season and there almost 3,000 more loads to go. Drivers are washing out and the road is beaten up.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's day 53 of the ice road season and only the toughest truckers remain on a road that's sent many people packing.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Spring brings a rush of warm weather and the big melt begins. The road is nearly empty as only the toughest or craziest truckers remain.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It is a job only a few would dare. This year, four ice road truckers, Hugh, Alex, Rick and Drew, return from last season to join Arctic veterans.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: After just two days in the Arctic, the critical demands of the oil exploration sites are testing the limits of the truckers and their machines.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Just five days into the Arctic adventure, Mother Nature is about to strike and wreak havoc on the ice roads.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's week two on the frozen tundra and the name of the game is Rig Move. MGM is breaking down camp and moving every last piece of equipment to a new base at Langley.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: After the storm clears, most of the truckers are ready to roll--all except Rick, who is on the verge of quitting and looks to Hugh for advice.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's Christmas day, and Dog sets out to nab Raymond, who robs to support his ice habit, and give him a little Christmas gift - shiny new handcuffs. A passerby in Chinatown tells Dog that Raymond's asleep on a park bench.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: This fugitive has a bad reputation and a knack for running from the law. The pursuit has Dog and team traveling through an urban dystopia of suspicion, false leads and mistrust.

programme.desc: When Dog decides to spend the day caring for his newest granddaughter, Beth enlists the girls to hunt down a female fugitive. Heading into a dangerous part of town the ladies will use their feminine wiles to track this mother gone wrong.

programme.desc: This one is close to home. Dog's target on today's hunt is the cousin of Kali, Garry Boy's caregiver. In addition she has a reputation as a brawler. With Duane Lee still missing from the team Baby Lyssa decides she will step-up in this hunt.

programme.desc: The mystery surrounding the death of Caylee Anthony grips the nation; the only thing more shocking than the testimony is the verdict itself.

programme.desc: The discovery of Travis Alexander's body, stabbed, slit and shot in the neck, shocked his friends and family; Arizona police charge his girlfriend Jodi Arias with his murder.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Mark Sievers thought he had arranged the perfect murder when he hired a childhood friend and another man to murder his wife, Dr. Teresa Sievers; his best laid plan started falling apart when someone he trusted the most turned on him.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Years after being found not guilty of the murders of Nicole Brown Simpson and Ron Goldman, OJ Simpson was back in a courtroom and again facing felony charges.

programme.desc: Robert Chambers speaks out after serving 15 years in prison for the 1986 murder of Jennifer Levin.

programme.title: 48 Hours
programme.desc: A woman wages a psychological war against the person she believes killed her daughter.

programme.title: 48 Hours
